questions.question: Which of these documents shows a person has passed a series of tests?
When are postgraduate certificates taken?
options: After the Certificate of Higher Education

questions.question: An academic certificate may be issued by a higher institution of education.
Which of the following qualifications is higher than a graduate certificate?
What is the purpose of an academic certificate?
options: It gives the holder a chance
It makes good impression on employers
It shows that the holders have acquired the stated skills
Its useful for making a CV beautiful

questions.question: Which of the following is not included in a certificate?
All academic certificates must be _____ before they are considered valid.
What are the three parts of a paragraph?
What is the purpose of the closing sentence?
options: It reminds the reader of the topic, and keeps them thinking.
It gives us details about the topic.
It lets us know what the paragraph is going to be about.

questions.question: A good topic sentence should always be...
What is the primary function of the Center for Academic Excellence?
options: To help failing or unmotivated students to succeed.
To assist students who are struggling with their assignments.
To help students become competent, self-motivated learners.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT the role of a tutor?
options: To supplement what the student is learning in the classroom.
To clarify information which the student did not fully grasp in class.
To help students comprehend material which they missed when they were absent from class.

questions.question: Which of the following will tutors NOT do?
What happens if a student arrives unprepared for a tutoring session?
options: The tutor will gladly produce a substitute lesson plan and teach an appropriate mini-lesson.
The tutor will record a no-show. A second no-show will result in the student's being barred from tutoring for the remainder of the semester.
The tutor will record a cancellation. Four cancellations will result in a student's being ineligible for tutoring for the remainder of the semester.
Nothing will happen. The tutor will simply surf the Internet for an hour while drawing a paycheck.

questions.question: How often is a student eligible to consult with a tutor?
options: In general, that will depend on the tutor's caseload and her perceptions of the student's needs. In most cases, this means twice a week up to a maximum of two courses.
There is no limit to how often a student may consult with a tutor.
Students may only receive one tutoring session per week during the semester, and twice a week during the summer intercession.
Tutors are too busy surfing the Internet to consult with students.

questions.question: If a student is failing a course (or expects to fail a course), will the student be able to receive tutoring.
options: All currently enrolled students are eligible for tutoring.
Students who are failing--or who expect to fail--are not eligible for tutoring.
The Center gladly accepts students who are failing their classes.
Students who are failing are more properly referred to the Success Center, where they may meet with an Academic Coach.
